result.execSummary:
The defendant Kimberly A Horton was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Each ct concur. If agent agrees at 18 mos early termination if successful without any violations or ATR's.   Transfer of probation authorized to IL.

miscConds.notes: DA has 90 days to prepare/submit order.

$200 DNA surcharge remitted. $343  to be collected by the Dept of Corrections.  Court financial obligations shall be paid at the rate of 25% of the prison wages and work release funds.  Restitution shall be paid pursuant to separate court order.  The balance remaining at release from prison be paid as a condition of extended supervision or parole at a rate determined by the supervising agent.
Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with SD. Banned from his residence except for what the family case allows in regards to children.

Completion of aggression/anger management treatment. Defendant shall complete a risk and needs assessment and comply with care plan goals related to prioritized need areas identified.  Defendant advised of requirement to provide DNA sample- P&P to take DNA.  Any other conditions DOC, Probation/Parole Department may impose.
$343  to be collected by the Dept of Corrections.
All other conditions are the same as count 1.
